skill.name: when-releasing-software-use-github-release-management
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub release orchestration with AI swarm coordination for automated versioning, testing, deployment, and rollback management. Coordinates release-manager, cicd-engineer, tester, and docs-writer agents through hierarchical topology to handle semantic versioning, changelog generation, release notes, deployment validation, and post-release monitoring. Supports multiple release strategies (rolling, blue-green, canary) and automated rollback. Use when creating releases, managing deployments, or coordinating version updates.

skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/prompt skill with no executable code. The skill defines release management workflows using natural language instructions for AI agents. All referenced scripts (semver.sh, deploy.sh, etc.) are documentation placeholders describing what operations should be performed - they do not exist in the skill and would need to be implemented separately by users. No network calls, filesystem access, environment variable reads, or command execution paths are present.

content.user_title: Automate software releases with AI agents
content.value_statement: Software releases require coordinating version bumps, testing, deployment, and documentation. This skill orchestrates multiple AI agents to handle the entire release workflow automatically. It ensures consistent processes, reduces human error, and provides rollback capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Coordinate hierarchical AI agent swarm for release operations
Determine version bumps using semantic versioning rules
Execute multi-phase release testing and validation
Generate changelogs and release notes automatically
Deploy using rolling, blue-green, or canary strategies
Trigger automated rollback on deployment failures
limitations: Requires existing deployment scripts in your project
Does not modify GitHub repository settings automatically
Cannot approve releases without human authorization
Monitoring requires configured health check endpoints

use_cases.title: Standard Release Orchestration
use_cases.description: Automate major, minor, and patch releases with full testing, staging validation, and production deployment.

use_cases.title: Hotfix Emergency Response
use_cases.description: Fast-track critical production fixes with expedited approval process and immediate deployment.

use_cases.title: Rollback Management
use_cases.description: Monitor deployments and automatically trigger rollback when health metrics exceed thresholds.

prompt_templates.title: Standard Release
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the GitHub release management skill to release version 2.1.0. Run through the standard release workflow with staging validation and production deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Hotfix Release
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the GitHub release management skill to create a hotfix for a critical production bug. Fast-track the approval and deploy immediately.

prompt_templates.title: Rolling Deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy the new release using a rolling strategy. Monitor health metrics and be ready to rollback if error rate exceeds 5 percent.

prompt_templates.title: Canary Rollout
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy the release using canary strategy at 10 percent traffic. Gradually increase to 25 percent, then 50 percent, then full rollout.

output_examples.input: Release version 1.5.0 using the standard workflow
output: Version determined: 1.5.0 (minor bump for new features)
All 47 tests passed in validation suite
Security review completed with no critical findings
Changelog generated with 3 features and 5 bug fixes
Production deployment started using rolling strategy

best_practices: Run staging validation before any production deployment to catch 80 percent of issues early
Use canary or rolling deployments for major releases to minimize blast radius
Always test rollback procedures before production deployment
anti_patterns: Skipping validation tests to meet release deadlines
Deploying without monitoring and health checks configured
Releasing without changelog or release notes documentation

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. It uses MCP tools from claude-flow for agent coordination.

faq.question: Does this skill deploy to any hosting platform?
faq.answer: No. The skill orchestrates agents but requires your own deployment scripts. The deploy.sh script handles platform-specific deployment.

faq.question: How does rollback work?
faq.answer: The skill monitors health metrics during deployment. If error rate exceeds thresholds, it triggers rollback to the previous version using rollback.sh.

faq.question: Is my repository data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only coordinates agents that follow your existing workflows. No data is sent to external services beyond your configured deployment targets.

faq.question: What if tests fail during release?
faq.answer: Any validation test failure blocks the release. The skill documents the failure and waits for human investigation before retry or abort.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: This skill coordinates AI agents that can make decisions and adapt workflows. GitHub Actions runs predefined scripts. They can work together.
